titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Kichimatsu Taguchi papers, 1909-1935 LSC.2010.32
titlestmt.subtitle: Japanese American Research Project (JARP) Collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Manuscripts Division staff; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cubé

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-08-24 13:36:33 -0700.

did.abstract: Kichimatsu Taguchi was born in 1881 in Yamaguchi Prefecture, Japan. He arrived in Hawaii in 1900; settled in Colorado ca. 1908. He was the owner of the Taguchi Company and joint owner of Manzanola Farming Company, both in Rocky Ford, Colorado. This collection consists of business records related to the shipment of cantaloupes harvested in Rocky Ford, Colorado, in association with George N. Dobashi, and personal correspondence. The collection also contains account books related to the Taguchi Company and Manzanola Farming Company. Some of the collection is in Japanese.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.
did.langmaterial: Materials are in English and Japanese.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Kichimatsu Taguchi Papers, Japanese American Research Project Collection (Collection 2010). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Kichimatsu Taguchi was born 1881; a native of Yamaguchi Prefecture, he arrived in Hawaii in 1900; settled in Colorado ca. 1908; owner of the Taguchi Company and joint owner of Manzanola Farming Company, both in Rocky Ford, Colorado.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of business records and personal correspondence related to businessman Kichimatsu Taguchi. The collection contains business records related to the shipment of cantaloupes harvested in Rocky Ford, Colorado, in association with George N. Dobashi, and includes correspondence, telegrams, bills, and receipts (1914-29). The collection also contains account books related to the Taguchi Company and Manzanola Farming Company (1909-35).
Materials in this collection are in English and Japanese.

altformavail.head: Additional Physical Form Available
altformavail.p: A copy of the original version of this online finding aid is available at the UCLA Department of Special Collections for in-house consultation and may be obtained for a fee. Please contact:

list.item: UCLA Library, Department of Special Collections
Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Japanese American Research Project Collection of Material about Japanese in the United States (Collection 2010) . Available at UCLA Library Special Collections.

controlaccess.subject: Japanese Americans -- Colorado -- Archives.
controlaccess.corpname: Japanese American Research Project (University of California, Los Angeles)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Taguchi Kichimatsu [characters] (1881- ). Merchant, Rocky Ford, Colorado. A native of Yamaguchi Prefecture who arrived in Hawaii in 1900 and transmigrated to mainland United States in 1904. Resident of Colorado from about 1908.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Chiefly on the shipment of cantaloupes from Rocky Ford, which Taguchi contracted in partnership with another Japanese, George N. Dobashi. Includes a few personal papers.

did.unittitle: Business correspondence on the shipment of cantaloupes.
Telegrams exchanged on the shipment of cantaloupes.
Reports on marketing information by the Department of Agriculture, Office of Markets and Rural Organization.
Statements on Taguchi's railroad damage claim of 1922.
Account books of the Taguchi Company and the Mansanola Farming Company in Rocky Ford, Colorado
An expense account book, covering the period August 1915-May 1924, of the Manzanola Farming Company owned jointly by 4 Japanese including Taguchi in Rocky Ford, Colorado.
3 cash books of the Taguchi Company.
Payment records of Japanese customers, Taguchi Company.
